intro: Fimbristylis decora, commonly known as the decorated sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in wetland restoration projects. Fimbristylis decora plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
